answers.answer: Depends on what you ate before you had the test. If you had something real sugary beforehand that might have affected it.They're going to run the 3 hour, fasting test just as precaution. At this point it's not a big deal. And if that one comes back high, they'll consider you to either have it be at risk of gestational diabetes. Which also, isn't that big of a deal. It's a serious thing, but not tragic. You'll be put on a special diet and as long as you follow it and take care of yourself and baby throughout the rest of the pregnancy it'll go away after delivery.Good luck.
I just did my 3 hours test and I passed. Don't eat anything b4 going. Schedule your appointment for morning and don't eat anything after midnight.you will be fine okay

question: So I went to my first glucose test and was told I had to come back for a 3 hour test because my sugar was a little high.... Should I be worried about this? Is it normal to have slightly elivated sugar levels when It you're prego?
title: glucose tests
